title: Black Bean Sweet Potatoes
directions: Bake sweet potatoes in a 400-degree F (204 C) oven directly on the baking rack for 40-45 minutes or until tender to the touch.
In the meantime, make guacamole and pico de gallo.
Remove from oven to cool to the touch, but leave oven on.
Carefully cut sweet potatoes in half and scoop out insides to make “boats.” Leave ~ 1/4 – 1/2 inch of flesh so they don’t become too fragile and difficult to handle.
Reserve leftover sweet potato for sweet potato almond butter muffins, or another recipe of your choice.
Mix black beans with chili, cumin, and lime juice.
Place sweet potato boats face up on a baking sheet and fill with black beans and top evenly with vegan cheese.
Pop back in oven to warm through and remove when vegan cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove from oven and arrange on a serving platter. Top with salsa, guacamole, chopped green onion and fresh cilantro.
Will reheat well the next day or two in the microwave or oven.
ingredients: 1 15-ounce can black beans, drained and rinsed, mixed with lime, chili, and cumin.
